Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2010 10:58PM AuELX wrote: 39 at my diagnosis. Went to the ER with excruciating lower back pain. Tests quickly revealed mets on several vertebra and a rib. A humble suggestion: What about conducting a poll about motherhood status? How many of us Stage IVs have had children? And how many of us haven't?
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: AuELX wrote: Hello - I'm about 4 months in to my Abraxane/Avastin chemo regime. The treatment is working very well and the side effects have been minimal except for the shortness of breath. It's now so bad that I am huffing and puffing at the slightest exertion, like walking from one room to another. Forget about climbing stairs or walking the dog. I also have a very high pulse rate (120s-140s) at every appointment, but my blood pressure is always normal. I am only very slightly anemic. My onco doesn't think I'm anemic enough to cause such shortness of breath.    My onco ordered tests. We have ruled out heart issues with an EKG and lung issues with a chest CT. And my latest test shows a normal TSH, so I do not have an overactive thyroid. Has anyone else experienced severe shortness of breath while on Abraxane/Avastin? Any ideas on what is causing my shortness of breath ... and what can be done to improve it? I'm desperate to get any improvement. And I'm exceedingly grateful for any suggestions. Thanks so much!!! 10 years and still counting! Dx 10/1/2005, Stage IV, mets, ER+, HER2- Radiation Therapy 10/1/2005 Bone Radiation Therapy 2/1/2008 Bone Hormonal Therapy Zoladex (goserelin) Chemotherapy CMF Chemotherapy Abraxane (albumin-bound or nab-paclitaxel), Adriamycin (doxorubicin), Gemzar (gemcitabine), Navelbine (vinorelbine), Taxol (paclitaxel) Hormonal Therapy Tamoxifen pills (Nolvadex, Apo-Tamox, Tamofen, Tamone) Hormonal Therapy Femara (letrozole) Targeted Therapy Ibrance (palbociclib) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Severe Shortness of Breath w/ Abraxane and Avastin AuELX AuELX

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2010 10:20PM AuELX wrote: Hello MCTHO - I just hit my five year mark. I was diagnosed with Cancer of Unknown Origin (CUP) presumed to be Breast Cancer in Oct 2005. While no lesions have ever been found in either breast, I've had multiple bone mets on my vertebra, ribs, and ilium. Lots of radiation treatment and bone scans, but no chemo or surgery thus far. We're all "survivors" regardless of how long. -AuELX
Posts.Title: WANTED: STAGE IV FIVE YEAR SURVIVORS! MCTHO eag1954
